page.title: 04ECOLOGY, DEEPCAR AND WORTLEY
page.content: {POLLUTION:}The{rivers}have long been affected by the heavy industry but the standards are rapidly improving. The presence of kingfishers is evidence of this. Domestic water has been discoloured from peat in Langsett Reservoir but new filter plant is opening soon. Heavy traffic on the {roads}causes atmospheric pollution with fumes and noise. Manchester Road traffic survey found that there was a large proportion of buses and lorries in a half hour period. The proposed {by-pass}will alleviate this problem but will greatly disturb some beautiful scenery at Plank Gate. Ash clouds from by-pass work at Burnstones Tip have caused problems. Another modern problem is that of low flying military{aircraft}on manoeuvres. A variety of{lichens}on Wharncliffe Chase indicates clean air on hills.
